question: Will the US frac spread count for the week ending March 28, 2025 fall between 228 and 234 (inclusive)?
reasoning:
Based on the gathered information, here is the analysis of the US frac spread count:

1. **Recent Trends:**
   - On February 28, 2025, the total frac spreads were 214.
   - On March 7, 2025, the total frac spreads decreased to 210.
   - On March 14, 2025, the total frac spreads increased slightly to 212.

2. **Historical Context:**
   - The frac spread count has been fluctuating slightly week over week, with small increases and decreases.
   - The count has not shown any significant upward trend that would suggest a rapid increase to the range of 228 to 234 within the next two weeks.

3. **Probability Assessment:**
   - Given the current count of 212 and the recent trend of small weekly changes, reaching a count between 228 and 234 by March 28, 2025, would require a substantial increase in the frac spread count over the next two weeks.
   - The historical data does not indicate a pattern of such rapid increases in the frac spread count.

Based on this analysis, the probability that the US frac spread count for the week ending March 28, 2025, will fall between 228 and 234 (inclusive) is low.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1

search_results.title: https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-march-2025
search_results.content:
---
title: Oil Market Report - March 2025 – Analysis - IEA
url: https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-march-2025
hostname: iea.org
description: Oil Market Report - March 2025 - Analysis and key findings. A report by the International Energy Agency.
sitename: IEA
date: 2025-03-13
---
#### About this report

The IEA Oil Market Report (OMR) is one of the world's most authoritative and timely sources of data, forecasts and analysis on the global oil market – including detailed statistics and commentary on oil supply, demand, inventories, prices and refining activity, as well as oil trade for IEA and selected non-IEA countries.

#### Highlights

- Growth in global oil demand is set to accelerate to just over 1 mb/d this year, from 830 kb/d in 2024, reaching 103.9 mb/d. Asia accounts for almost 60% of gains, led by China where petrochemical feedstocks will provide the entirety of growth. Amid an unusually uncertain macroeconomic climate, recent delivery data have been below expectations, leading to slightly lower estimates for 4Q24 and 1Q25 growth at 1.2 mb/d y-o-y.
- World oil supply rose by 240 kb/d in February to 103.3 mb/d, led by OPEC+. Kazakhstan pumped at an all-time high as Tengiz ramped up, while Iran and Venezuela boosted flows ahead of tighter sanctions. Non-OPEC+ production is set to rise by 1.5 mb/d in 2025, led by the Americas. Following a 770 kb/d output decline last year, OPEC+ output could hold steady in 2025 if voluntary cuts are maintained after April.
- Global crude runs dropped by 570 kb/d m-o-m to 82.8 mb/d in February, extending their decline from December’s five-year high of 84.3 mb/d, on planned and unplanned outages. Throughputs are forecast to average 83.3 mb/d in 2025, up 570 kb/d y-o-y as lower OECD activity partly offsets a 930 kb/d annual increase in the non-OECD. Refining margins recovered in February, as falling crude prices lifted profitability in all regions.
- Global observed oil stocks fell by 40.5 mb in January, of which 26.1 mb were products. Non‑OECD crude stocks plunged by 45.3 mb, dominated by China where imports declined. Total OECD stocks rose by 11.2 mb, boosted by a 25 mb build in industry crude inventories. Oil on water fell by 6.7 mb. However, preliminary data for February show total global oil stocks rebounded, lifted by an increase in oil on water.
- Oil prices declined by about $7/bbl in February and early March as macro sentiment soured amid escalating trade tensions, clouding the outlook for oil demand…

content.snippet:
---
title: Oil Market Report - March 2025 – Analysis - IEA
url: https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-march-2025
hostname: iea.org
description: Oil Market Report - March 2025 - Analysis and key findings. A report by the International Energy Agency.
sitename: IEA
date: 2025-03-13
---
#### About this report

The IEA Oil Market Report (OMR) is one of the world's most authoritative and timely sources of data, forecasts and analysis on the global oil market – including detailed statistics and commentary on oil supply, demand, inventories, prices and refining activity, as well as oil trade for IEA and selected non-IEA countries.

#### Highlights

- Growth in global oil demand is set to accelerate to just over 1 mb/d this year, from 830 kb/d in 2024, reaching 103.9 mb/d. Asia accounts for almost 60% of gains, led by China where petrochemical feedstocks will provide the entirety of growth. Amid an unusually uncertain macroeconomic climate, recent delivery data have been below expectations, leading to slightly lower estimates for 4Q24 and 1Q25 growth at 1.2 mb/d y-o-y.
- World oil supply rose by 240 kb/d in February to 103.3 mb/d, led by OPEC+. Kazakhstan pumped at an all-time high as Tengiz ramped up, while Iran and Venezuela boosted flows ahead of tighter sanctions. Non-OPEC+ production is set to rise by 1.5 mb/d in 2025, led by the Americas. Following a 770 kb/d output decline last year, OPEC+ output could hold steady in 2025 if voluntary cuts are maintained after April.
- Global crude runs dropped by 570 kb/d m-o-m to 82.8 mb/d in February, extending their decline from December’s five-year high of 84.3 mb/d, on planned and unplanned outages. Throughputs are forecast to average 83.3 mb/d in 2025, up 570 kb/d y-o-y as lower OECD activity partly offsets a 930 kb/d annual increase in the non-OECD. Refining margins recovered in February, as falling crude prices lifted profitability in all regions.
- Global observed oil stocks fell by 40.5 mb in January, of which 26.1 mb were products. Non‑OECD crude stocks plunged by 45.3 mb, dominated by China where imports declined. Total OECD stocks rose by 11.2 mb, boosted by a 25 mb build in industry crude inventories. Oil on water fell by 6.7 mb. However, preliminary data for February show total global oil stocks rebounded, lifted by an increase in oil on water.
- Oil prices declined by about $7/bbl in February and early March as macro sentiment soured amid escalating trade tensions, clouding the outlook for oil demand…

[Truncated preview: showing 411 words out of ~1344. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]

{"url": "https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-march-2025", "snippet": "---

---
#### About this report

The IEA Oil Market Report (OMR) is one of the world's most authoritative and timely sources of data, forecasts and analysis on the global oil market – including detailed statistics and commentary on oil supply, demand, inventories, prices and refining activity, as well as oil trade for IEA and selected non-IEA countries.

#### Highlights

- Growth in global oil demand is set to accelerate to just over 1 mb/d this year, from 830 kb/d in 2024, reaching 103.9 mb/d. Asia accounts for almost 60% of gains, led by China where petrochemical feedstocks will provide the entirety of growth. Amid an unusually uncertain macroeconomic climate, recent delivery data have been below expectations, leading to slightly lower estimates for 4Q24 and 1Q25 growth at 1.2 mb/d y-o-y.
- World oil supply rose by 240 kb/d in February to 103.3 mb/d, led by OPEC+. Kazakhstan pumped at an all-time high as Tengiz ramped up, while Iran and Venezuela boosted flows ahead of tighter sanctions. Non-OPEC+ production is set to rise by 1.5 mb/d in 2025, led by the Americas. Following a 770 kb/d output decline last year, OPEC+ output could hold steady in 2025 if voluntary cuts are maintained after April.
- Global crude runs dropped by 570 kb/d m-o-m to 82.8 mb/d in February, extending their decline from December’s five-year high of 84.3 mb/d, on planned and unplanned outages. Throughputs are forecast to average 83.3 mb/d in 2025, up 570 kb/d y-o-y as lower OECD activity partly offsets a 930 kb/d annual increase in the non-OECD. Refining margins recovered in February, as falling crude prices lifted profitability in all regions.
- Global observed oil stocks fell by 40.5 mb in January, of which 26.1 mb were products. Non‑OECD crude stocks plunged by 45.3 mb, dominated by China where imports declined. Total OECD stocks rose by 11.2 mb, boosted by a 25 mb build in industry crude inventories. Oil on water fell by 6.7 mb. However, preliminary data for February show total global oil stocks rebounded, lifted by an increase in oil on water.
- Oil prices declined by about $7/bbl in February and early March as macro sentiment soured amid escalating trade tensions, clouding the outlook for oil demand…

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the US frac spread count for the week ending March 28, 2025 fall between 228 and 234 (inclusive)?
Background: For base rate information, see [US - Oil Rig Count vs. Frac Spread Count](https://en.macromicro.me/collections/19/mm-oil-price/34190/us-oil-rig-count-vs-frac-crew-spread-count)
Resolution criteria: This question resolves as 'Yes' if the Total Frac Spreads for the week ending March 28, 2025, according to the American Oil & Gas Reporter [tracking page](https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count/2025), falls between 228 and 234 (inclusive). Otherwise, it resolves as 'No'.
Fine print: For reference, a recent count for the week ending February 28, 2025 was 214 frac spreads.
present_date: 2025-03-21T19:42:33.739900


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

Otherwise, it resolves as 'No'.","fine_print":"For reference, a recent count for the week ending February 28, 2025 was 214 frac spreads.","present_date":"2025-03-21T19:42:33.739900"}

messages.content:
{"url": "https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-march-2025", "snippet": "---
title: Oil Market Report - March 2025 – Analysis - IEA
url: https://www.iea.org/reports/oil-market-report-march-2025
hostname: iea.org
description: Oil Market Report - March 2025 - Analysis and key findings. A report by the International Energy Agency.
sitename: IEA
date: 2025-03-13
---
#### About this report

The IEA Oil Market Report (OMR) is one of the world's most authoritative and timely sources of data, forecasts and analysis on the global oil market – including detailed statistics and commentary on oil supply, demand, inventories, prices and refining activity, as well as oil trade for IEA and selected non-IEA countries.

#### Highlights

- Growth in global oil demand is set to accelerate to just over 1 mb/d this year, from 830 kb/d in 2024, reaching 103.9 mb/d. Asia accounts for almost 60% of gains, led by China where petrochemical feedstocks will provide the entirety of growth. Amid an unusually uncertain macroeconomic climate, recent delivery data have been below expectations, leading to slightly lower estimates for 4Q24 and 1Q25 growth at 1.2 mb/d y-o-y.
- World oil supply rose by 240 kb/d in February to 103.3 mb/d, led by OPEC+. Kazakhstan pumped at an all-time high as Tengiz ramped up, while Iran and Venezuela boosted flows ahead of tighter sanctions. Non-OPEC+ production is set to rise by 1.5 mb/d in 2025, led by the Americas. Following a 770 kb/d output decline last year, OPEC+ output could hold steady in 2025 if voluntary cuts are maintained after April.
- Global crude runs dropped by 570 kb/d m-o-m to 82.8 mb/d in February, extending their decline from December’s five-year high of 84.3 mb/d, on planned and unplanned outages. Throughputs are forecast to average 83.3 mb/d in 2025, up 570 kb/d y-o-y as lower OECD activity partly offsets a 930 kb/d annual increase in the non-OECD. Refining margins recovered in February, as falling crude prices lifted profitability in all regions.
- Global observed oil stocks fell by 40.5 mb in January, of which 26.1 mb were products. Non‑OECD crude stocks plunged by 45.3 mb, dominated by China where imports declined. Total OECD stocks rose by 11.2 mb, boosted by a 25 mb build in industry crude inventories. Oil on water fell by 6.7 mb. However, preliminary data for February show total global oil stocks rebounded, lifted by an increase in oil on water.
- Oil prices declined by about $7/bbl in February and early March as macro sentiment soured amid escalating trade tensions, clouding the outlook for oil demand…

[Truncated preview: showing 411 words out of ~1344. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]", "word_count": 1344, "snippet_word_count": 411, "snippet_truncated": true, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-02-21T19:42:33.739900", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-03-22T19:42:33.739900", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T06:55:14.427541"}

function.name: btf_extract_evidence
function.arguments: {"url":"https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count","question":"Will the US frac spread count for the week ending March 28, 2025 fall between 228 and 234 (inclusive)?","background":"For base rate information, see [US - Oil Rig Count vs. Frac Spread Count](https://en.macromicro.me/collections/19/mm-oil-price/34190/us-oil-rig-count-vs-frac-crew-spread-count)","resolution_criteria":"This question resolves as 'Yes' if the Total Frac Spreads for the week ending March 28, 2025, according to the American Oil & Gas Reporter [tracking page](https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count/2025), falls between 228 and 234 (inclusive). Otherwise, it resolves as 'No'.","fine_print":"For reference, a recent count for the week ending February 28, 2025 was 214 frac spreads.","present_date":"2025-03-21T19:42:33.739900","date_cutoff_start":"2025-02-21T19:42:33.739900","date_cutoff_end":"2025-03-22T19:42:33.739900"}

messages.content: {"question_id": "ad863b6d-6a19-5ff9-a7e1-f17b5bfecac5", "url": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "facts": [{"title": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "url": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "fact": "On March 14, 2025, the total frac spreads were 212, showing an increase of 2 from the previous week."}, {"title": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "url": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "fact": "On March 7, 2025, the total frac spreads were 210, showing a decrease of 4 from the previous week."}, {"title": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "url": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "fact": "On February 28, 2025, the total frac spreads were 214, showing an increase of 4 from the previous week."}, {"title": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "url": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "fact": "On February 21, 2025, the total frac spreads were 210, showing an increase of 7 from the previous week."}, {"title": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "url": "https://www.aogr.com/web-exclusives/us-frac-spread-count", "fact": "On February 14, 2025, the total frac spreads were 203, showing an increase of 5 from the previous week."}]}
messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the gathered information, here is the analysis of the US frac spread count:

1. **Recent Trends:**
   - On February 28, 2025, the total frac spreads were 214.
   - On March 7, 2025, the total frac spreads decreased to 210.
   - On March 14, 2025, the total frac spreads increased slightly to 212.

2. **Historical Context:**
   - The frac spread count has been fluctuating slightly week over week, with small increases and decreases.
   - The count has not shown any significant upward trend that would suggest a rapid increase to the range of 228 to 234 within the next two weeks.

3. **Probability Assessment:**
   - Given the current count of 212 and the recent trend of small weekly changes, reaching a count between 228 and 234 by March 28, 2025, would require a substantial increase in the frac spread count over the next two weeks.
   - The historical data does not indicate a pattern of such rapid increases in the frac spread count.

Based on this analysis, the probability that the US frac spread count for the week ending March 28, 2025, will fall between 228 and 234 (inclusive) is low.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1
